Here is a summary of what types of interactivity each plot supports:

LET'S SUMMARIZE WHAT TYPES OF INTERACTIVITY EACH PLOT TYPE SUPPORTS IN A TABLE.

Read more about [TypesOfInteractivity types of supported interactivity] and [PlotOptions supported plotting options].

== Scatter plot == 
 * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scatter_plot Scatter plot], display values for two variables for a set of data.
 * Regression (linear, loess) is enabled. The calculation for a regression line is done by the server side with R. (Shiny library is used here)
<img src="http://thepotter.woobi.co.kr/img/scatter.png">

== Bar plot == 
 * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_chart Bar plot], rectangular bars with lengths proportional to the values.
<img src="http://thepotter.woobi.co.kr/img/bar.png">

== Line plot == 
 * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Line_chart Line plot], displays information as a series of data points connected by straight line segments.
<img src="http://thepotter.woobi.co.kr/img/box.png">

== Pie chart == 
 * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pie_chart Pie chart], circular chart divided into sectors, illustrating numerical proportion.
<img src="http://thepotter.woobi.co.kr/img/pie.png">
